Smoothie place and minimart around the corner, and ethiopian and american restaurants within 5 blocks. But ALL of downtown Seattle is within a 20 minute walk. Theres a whole foods market and complex of restaurants about 5 minutes away. Pike Place, which is on the complete other end of the city is about 20 minutes away. Belltown, Capitol Hill bars, etc, all 20 minutes or less. This location is phenomenal. No safety concerns at all. The area is "up and coming" with a lot of lofts etc being built. But it wasnt a bad neighborhood before, just a mostly commercial/industrial. Finally, in addition to a fine fitness center onsite, complimentary access to a HUGE AMAZING 24-hr fitness directly across the street. All you do is show your ID, hotel key, and sign a waiver. wow. great. Bottom line: great location, great amenities, great value. If you are the Princess and the Pea, or aren't familiar with how to navigate cities more than 3 blocks in size, then maybe not for you.

Reviews.Title: “never again until they change the bedding”
Reviews.Author: thebigsub
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of september for one night,sheets and pillow cases worn to bits, and creased like one star. Complained to the management, and the car parking was taken off my bill. Very dissapointed with thebedding standard for $240 with tax Never again,.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: traveler50123
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on the Seattle Supersaver for 3 nights at the beginning of September, 2008. It proved to be an excellent choice. The hotel is modern and clean with a nice lobby and bar. The indoor swimming pool and whirlpool were great. The towels were provided, the water in the whirlpool was at just right temperature. There was a computer room on the ground floor with free internet access, two computers and a printer. Access provided with the room “key” (electronic card). All free of charge. The check-in and out was a breeze. The room was decent size with king size bed, living area with sofa, and a kitchenette. Everything worked fine. We did not use kitchenette. Excellent buffet breakfast was provided, and we did not feel like cooking dinners there. Fridge came handy though to store some drinks. It is true that there are no restaurants nearby, but a walk to downtown takes only about 20 minutes, and the selection there is very good. There was also free coffee in the lobby 24h a day, usually of quite decent quality and relatively fresh. Starbucks is across the street for more sophisticated brew. The area around hotel is not particularly pleasant and some may feel a bit uneasy in the evening. A lot better though than other areas in Seattle, for example around Pioneer Square. The Highway 5 is just outside the hotel. It is a bit noisy, but did not bother us, even that our room was on the highway side. Hotel charges extra for parking, but we did not have a car so we did not care. There is a free shuttle to downtown, but only every hour, and by reservation. We did not use this service. We walked everywhere. Both: downtown, and space needle area are only about 20 minutes walk from the hotel. Overall it was a great place to stay, and we would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Do not give them your credit card information!”
Reviews.Author: SarahSueNW
Reviews.Content: I had called this hotel July 21st to make a reservation for our Labor Day weekend stay, and the reservation went pretty smoothly... However, when I showed up to check in with my party and my luggage on the day of our reservation, they had no record of my reservation. They had managed to completely lose my name, my confirmation number, and any record of my phone call EXCEPT for my credit card number! They did have that recorded - UNDER A DIFFERENT NAME AND A DIFFERENT RESERVATION DATE! How this happened, I have really no idea, but the idea of them taking my credit card information is very frightening. That was the one piece of information they did manage to hang onto after mysteriously losing all of my contact information as well as my confirmation number! Well after telling me all this, of course they didn't have another room for me, since they were fully booked. They left us hanging on the Friday night of Labor Day weekend in downtown Seattle with no place to stay. I called today, after returning from my trip, and spoke to a manager to file a complaint. She was absolutely no help to me, and just said over and over "wow, I don't know how that happened". She did not offer me any sort of compensation for the expensive hotel we finally found while searching around Seattle after they refused us a room. Needless to say, I am never going there again, and I would advise future Seattle travelers to stay away - and DO NOT give them your credit card information!

Reviews.Title: “Far Out”
Reviews.Author: Doc707
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take a vacation to Seattle. Apparently, the entire population of North America had the same idea. The closest I could get to downtown was this SpringHill Suites. I wish we'd just chosen another city or another time. The "suite" was small, as with all such hotels of this sort, but was clean. As other reviewers have pointed out, there was some noise. The breakfast was excellent. The bed was hard as a rock and the pillows were abominable--even the replacements we asked them to give us. Free internet access was nice. Our main problem--it was a half- to three-quarter mile walk to any really decent restaurant. And the walk led through a questionable neighborhood. I was negatively impressed by the location, and would not stay here again. Oh, yes. We had a car (parked at $20 per night), but parking in downtown Seattle is a proble,, and quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: H2Odivr
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through SeattleSupersaver website for one night before a cruise. It was great! We got a $139 weekend rate which was lower than any other decent downtown hotel. It was a little further out than most hotels but was not a bad walk, even to the Pike Place Market. The hotel was very clean and well-kept and the staff was quite helpful and friendly. The bed was comfy. There is even a washer and drier, which we used due to something spilling in our suitcase. There is nothing to eat really close but a nice mall with restaraunts 10 or so blocks away. i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if downtown is not your only focus.”
Reviews.Author: timidtravelerUs
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good value. When we arrived we were booked on one of top floors, on the I-5 side of hotel. This room seemed too noisy for us, so we asked for and received a room change to a west side room. This was less noisy. This hotel is on busy streets and very near a highway, so it isn't the most quiet hotel. Still the west side room was fine and we slept well. The beds and linens were very comfortable. I wish the pillows were a bit firmer, but they were fine. Neutrogena body products were nice. Free wireless access, and a nice business center for printing, etc., also free. Access to nice gym across the street. The breakfast was great. There was fruit, waffles, oatmeal and other cereals, sausage, bacon and eggs, and the standard continental breakfast breads. Nice coffee and juice. I really appreciated the location. It is a doable walk both to Seattle Center and downtown. We had a car ( 20$ parking), and it was a breeze to get on highway and get to farther places. Seattle has a great bus system, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: MrsOdie
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 girlfriends of mine stayed at this hotel for a long weekend in June. We all shared a room with 2 double beds and 1 pull-out sofa bed. My only complaint about the room would be that if it was just even 1 foot deeper, it would be been perfect. When the sofabed is pulled out it touches the other two beds so you have to climb over it to get to the bathroom. Other than that, the room was a good size and was just right for us. We arrived late on a Thursday night and to my chagrin there was no linen bundle for the sofa bed. I rang the front desk and had everything I needed in less than 5 minutes. The following morning I rang to request extra towels and had those delivered to me as well in under 5 minutes. Breakfast was included, which was a huge plus. On offer were both hot & cold items of every description, both healthy and not so healthy foods, there was even a waffle station! We were extremely satisfied with the breakfast and found it to be tremendous value. The beds (even the pull-out) were very comfortable and the linens were soft and cozy. I found all the staff to be pleasant and very helpful. We did not use the hotel's shuttle service, so I cannot comment on that. We walked everywhere and if we were tired at the end of the day we hailed a cab. The location of the hotel is good, but do you need to walk (or use the hotel shuttle service). It took us about 15 minutes to walk to the Space Needle and about the same to get to the waterfront. Keep in mind that Seattle is very hilly, so be prepared for that. We booked our room through the hotel's website directly, which was the same price as Expedia. After all was said and done in terms of taxes, it was $218 a night, which I think is great for 3 people in a city. All 3 of us were very pleased with this hotel and I would certainly stay there again or try any other Springhill Suites hotel in any other location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay over the week of the 4th”
Reviews.Author: Eddiechuck
Reviews.Content: Priceline $70/night...couldn't beat it for downtown. OK, so it was a bit out of downtown, but we still walked!. We're both 55 and found no trouble walking to and from Safeco Field. One day we caught the hotel shuttle to Westlake Center, then hoofed it. Another day we did catch a free bus from downtown, (remember the city bus is free as long as you're in the yellow part of town....get a map!). Other 2 games we walked back and forth. How far is it? Far, but how far ,I don't know. You can get there in a half hour. So if we can walk to Safeco, you can get to the Market or the Space Needle. Some reviews mentioned noise from I-5. A week b4 we arrived I called and requested a room away from it. I was told that rooms would be assigned the day of arrival, but that my request would be entered. It was, and we got a room away from the freeway. The room was great, but the breakfast each morning, was even better. Just about anything you can imagine, within reason. No omelets, fired eggs or pancakes, but just about everything else: waffles, hard boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, bagels, cold/hot cereal, fruit, sausage, bacon, juice, milk, coffee 24/7. This place can't be beat. I don't care what anyone says!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great service - great price !!”
Reviews.Author: CapeCodSmiley
Reviews.Content: I am shocked that anyone would rate this hotel less than excellent. The staff was wonderful, the rooms clean, breakfast delicious, the shuttle was handy and the health club across the street was awsome. Sure you can pay $250+ and be right downtown, but if you don't mind walking 10-12 minutes to all the major sites this is the place to stay. We took advantage of their free shuttle which runs on the hour for some trips, but it was very easy just to walk. I left a few things behind and the housecleaning staff placed it in their safe until I was able to pick it up a week later when our Alaskan cruise was over. I am a light sleeper and asked for a room in the front of the building on the 10th floor and slept through the night. They even arranged a $7 shuttle ride to the docks for us. Free internet use was a added bonus. I have already recommended this hotel to friends going to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Springhill Suites”
Reviews.Author: KellyAnneinNJ
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Springhill Suites 5/15-5/18, spending a few days in Seattle prior our Alaskan cruise. I guess we are not the only cruis goers that know about this hotel. Sunday morning it was swamped with cruisers checking in oand out! We enjoyed our stay immensely. The fab rate we got from Priceline made it a steal, we paid just $75.00 a night. What a bargin for this hotel, a full hot breakfast included everyday and a shuttle service that got us around. A major concern for us was transportation to the Pier for our cruise. I looked into to shuttle, cabs, Towncars, etc. prior to leaving an found various fare, all as around $35++. This seemed crazy since the hotel is less than 3 miles from the Pier. I inquired at the front desk and they made arrangement on a shuttle for us at just $4.50 a person! Again what a steal. Another couple staying at the Springhill Suites called a cab, we beat them to the Pier and they paid $35 plus a tip. The hotel staff was great, extremely friendly and very knowledgable. I read other reviews and was a little concerned about the noise. Other members of our party are light sleepers. No complaints regarding the noise. They did mention the drapery issue, and the early morning sunlight. Turns out they did not see the cords room darkening drapes, no problem after we showed them! We definitely enjoyed our stay and visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: kellyjam
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I requested a room away from the the the Interstate but to be honest all sides of the hotel are bordered by city streets. At night there were sirens, motorcycles etc. It was as loud as staying in a Manhattan hotel. So if you are looking for a quiet nights sleep you might be disappointed. The room was nice and the bed was VERY firm. They give you these half pillows. There are about 8 on the bed but I couldn't get used to them. The toilet was clogged the first time we used it but housekeeping was there 5 minutes after we called them. The breakfast which was included was outstanding. You had the waffle iron, eggs, bacon,sausage,cereal, toast ,bagels, english muffins, toast, fruit and fruit juices,yogurt,danish and of course coffee. (Hazelnut,regular and decaf.) I had no problem ever getting a table. I figured this saved me $20 bucks a day for my wife and myself. The staff are super friendly and efficient. They have a cocktail lounge were you can get appetizers and a happy hour from 4-7. I had the friends and family rates of $89 a night and no car so I didn't have to deal with parking. Their shuttle service takes you to the Westlake Center and the Space Needle on the hour. ( It would be nice if they added a stop at Pikes Market.) You can also call them for pick up service as well. You are about a mile from the Westlake center and 2 miles to Pike's Market. You can catch a bus outside the hotel which takes you downtown, but beware nobody in Seattle including the Bus drivers know how this system works. I had three large books which I got on various buses and mine still weren't listed in them. There are hundreds of buses in this city. You only can buy an All Day pass on the bus on the weekends. During the week you have to find an outlet that sells them, the location of which, seems to be a State secret. However I must say everyone is cheerfully willing to give you advice so it was hard for me to get mad for incorrect advice because Seattlians are so nice. There are a lot of hills in the city but if you like walking this hotel is a great choice because you are no more than 2 miles from anything. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: funmomwithteens
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Springhill Suites last night while in town for Supercross race at Qwest stadium. Got a great rate, with taxes and valet parking fee $103., but still not worth it IMO. The front desk people were great, gave me keys to 2 rooms to check out the noice level, I selected a room on the back side of the 9th floor which had a view of the sound, which was nice. The drapes are only for looks as they do not close (why?), so at about 5am the room started to light up, and though the noice from the Interstate was not loud enough to wake us up it was loud enough to keep us awake combined with the lit up room! The $21.78 manditory valet parking was a pain, we called ahead, our car was there when we came down but we had to wait for a long time to get the keys because they were so unorganized. Marriott has been consistently one of our favorite places to stay around the US, but not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty great”
Reviews.Author: bkem
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an awesome deal! We booked through seattlesupersaver.com and it was only $100 a night for king suites! It's in sort of a random spot but it's a quick walk, shuttle ride or cab ride to downtown stuff. They have a shuttle that leaves the hotel once an hour and it was only $6-8 for a cab ride to other neighborhoods. The rooms were big and clean and and the hot breakfast buffet was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience All Around..”
Reviews.Author: pharmernicole
Reviews.Content: Taking other posters' advice, we called ahead to request a room NOT on the interstate side of the hotel, and they gladly complied. We arrived late on a Friday night .. room was clean, quiet, and nice. Our room had a king size bed, jack and jill bathroom, pullout sofa, and sink, mini-fridge and microwave. Breakfast in the morning was great -- Saturday morning was a little busy, there were not enough tables for the quantity of people at breakfast so we had to take our breakfast back to the room to eat it -- lots to choose from: waffles, bagels, cereal, eggs, sausage, bacon, fruit, cottage cheese, coffee, tea, juice, milk.. Location was right off I-5, great for drivers -- my husband and I did alot of walking to see the sights and we decided it was "almost" too far to walk downtown or to the waterfront. We did it twice -- took about 25 minutes. Starbucks across the street (of course!!) , Subway across the street as well .. REI is less than 2 blocks away, a nice place to see closeby! Hotel bar closed at 11pm on Saturday night, seemed odd.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: robstrash
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 week and enjoyed it. My wife had a conference at the convention center Sun-Wed and I worked from the hotel room. The chair, desk, and free wired internet were fine and I had no problems. The mini-fridge was nice to have too. We didn't use the 24 hour fitness directly across the street but it was free with room card. We did use the hotel pool/hot tub and it was nice. It was only 10-15 minute walk to the convention center if you weren't able to take the hotel shuttle that only left on the hour. We did have a room on the 5th floor that faced the highway (I-5 is very close). The traffic was somewhat loud, but I didn't find it very disturbing. I always bring earplugs when staying in hotels and slept fine with them in. If you are sensitive to noise, you should request a room that does not face I-5. The only real complaint I had was it was all one big room. I guess I am used to Embassy Suites where the bedroom is separated by a wall and door. You could not have one person sleep and another watch TV since the TV was between the bed and couch (with 1/2 wall between them). The breakfast was surprisingly good. You could make your own waffles and they even had fruit and whipped cream toppings along with maple and boysenberry syrup. They had 5+ types of cereal, several types of breads and toasters, bacon, sausage, oatmeal, fruit, and milk/juices/coffee daily. Some days they even had pancakes, but not every day. Overall, a nice hotel with free internet and free breakfast downtown. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: golfnsail
Reviews.Content: The Springhill Suites was a pleasant surprise. It was very clean, rooms were spacious with a mini fridge and a microwave. A free hot breakfast every morning, and most of all the friendliest staff I have encountered in a long time. They also have an arrangement to use the facilities at the 24 hour gym across the street free of charge. I would suggest not renting a car since driving and parking in Seattle is a total disaster, plus you end up spending a small fortune on parking no matter where you go. They have an hourly free shuttle that goes to the Space Needle and shopping area, and from there you can catch the monorail. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms but very noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: Alaskabound2
Reviews.Content: Its a late review but it won't change the fact that the location of certain rooms expose you to a LOT of noise. The rooms facing the freeway are simply to noisy to be able to any sleep in. We stayed two nights prior to boarding our cruise to Alaska in 2007. We didn't get much sleep even with headphones on (for me) and earplugs (my mom) in out attempt to drown out the car noise outside of our windows. The rooms were clean and the microwave and fridge were convenient but the noise undermined any positive aspects of this place. AVOID rooms by the freeways if you can.

Reviews.Title: “quick 2 day getaway”
Reviews.Author: conchshelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Springhill Marriot and had a great experience. The shuttle would drop off/pick up every hour at 3 main locations in the city. We had a rental car but never really used it. There is only valet serive at 18 dollars a day so be forwarned. Great servie, friendly staff. We did the Duck tour which was really fun. Land and water vehicle tour that had a very fuuny talented guide. Would recommed to do a tour first day so that you can get a better feel of the city. The Space needle is a must do but the dinner was very expensive and not really worth the cost. Howver if you have never been in a building with a rotating floor its quite amazing. Only the resturant portion moves. I full rotation ever 47 minutes. Make reservations or go really early (opens at 5p) Pike's Place market is where all the mom and pop shops are and the 1st starbucks. Also, they throw the fish there. All resturants were good and we particular;y like the WIld Ginger for an asian theme of food. Overall great time we got rained on the first day but otherwise very friendly, amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay at the Springhill Suites”
Reviews.Author: Ediver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Springhill Suites from November 21-24. We drove from California-terrible traffic from Salem to Vancouver WA. Arrived at 9:30pm. We were immediately helped from our car, however, there was no one to bring up our luggage so my husband brought a luggage cart to the car to unload. Since we had been driving for a long time, we sort of had things all over the car. The vallet was sort of in a hurry to park our car and we were unable to remove everything. By the time we got to our room we realized we were missing several items. We had to wait for the vallet to come back and then ask for the keys and directions to our car. We then had to hand carry many items to the room. The room was nice. However, the sofa bed looked a bit old and tired. Unfortunantly, the beds were only doubles. It was my husband and I and our daughter. All rooms have only double beds unless you order a king room. Most hotel rooms I have stayed in offer two queen beds. Room was very stuffy and there was no way to create a more unstuffy environment, we even turned on the A/C and ran the fan. The toilet was not in very good working order and we had to call housekeeping on several occasions. On Thanksgiving day there was no room service until 5:00pm. We were visiting with family so we wanted some appetizers in the room. We had to go down to the bar and pick these up. Also, not much space in the room to eat. The breakfast is fair, but very boring with styrofoam plates and plastic silverware. My grandson did enjoy the indoor pool and sauna. That was very nice. Parking $18.00 - when our son and his family came to visit, his parking fee was $10.00. Overall check in and out was very easy, our room was clean, beds comfortable but too small and staff was friendly and helpful. I think on my next trip to Seattle I will look a smaller hotel less commerical hotel.

Reviews.Title: “North of Downtown but hourly shuttle- teenage son Loved it”
Reviews.Author: elyette
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you are sleeping in Seattle, check out Seattlesupersaver.com. It often offers the cheapest rates. It is part of the Seattle Chamber of Commerce. You don't have to pay up front and you can cancel your reservation without penalty. I stayed here in a studio suite with a teenage son. He liked having a pool to "check out the chicks." He didn't care that he was in a suite with Mom. He just crashed on the sofa bed. This hotel remains a great value. We had a refrigerator, microwave and kitchen sink area which my teenage boy needed. There is also a hot breakfast included. You can't beat the value. The hotel was spotless and very accommodating. If noise bothers you, ask for a room away from the street. Even a higher floor may not do. Valet parking only and it costs extra. But they do have an hourly shuttle. If you have a car, this is the way to go. It is my third time here, on business, pleasure and with a teenager. Each time, the hotel has been close to perfect. My son only wants to stay at Marriotts. He has been spoiled rotten by them. The only reason I didn't give this a five star is that some folks will find the street noisy and the hotel is not in old downtown. I will point out, however, that the new downtown has moved north and that this hotel is smack in the middle of it. The new businesses tend to be non-retail, except for REI. However, medical and legal offices abound, so if you are staying on business involving one of these industries, you would do well to stay here. Queen Anne and Capitol Hill neighborhoods are conveniently accessible by car. The Shuttle probably stops there as well. Ask the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Spring hill suprise”
Reviews.Author: JP3CHICAGO
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a meeting in September 07. The location was a little out of the way for a true "downtown" location. The shuttle services at the Seattle Airport do not stop at this location so I was forced to take a ride into "downtown" and then hire a cab to finish the journey. The hotel does have a shuttle that brings you to town about twice an hour. It is an adequate service and needed for this out of the way location. Due to the time change my flight arrived pretty early in the day. When booking I had requested a room to be ready by 10 am so that I would be able to freshen up prior to my meeting. I understand that this is an extra special request for a property at this level. The front desk staff was quite accomodating upon my arrival, noted my request, and found an available room within ten minutes. Imagine my suprise when I found some underwear, used toothpaste, soap, and shampoo still residing in the bathroom that was supposedly ready for my stay. The front desk seemed concerned and quickly arranged to send me to another room. Overall it is just an average property. I think that there may be a better value for the dollar within a few blocks of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: wildlife_girl
Reviews.Content: The reviews of this hotel before my trip made it seem like it would be just an average experience. I thought it was great. The room was large and nice. I was on a higher floor so I did not hear any of the street noise despite being right next to the highway. The breakfast goes above and beyond in my opinion for a meal included in your room rate. You can walk to shops downtown but it is not just a couple of blocks away. The hotel shuttle is super convenient and takes you downtown and also to the space needle and they will come pick you up as well. I thought it was definitely worth what they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and location”
Reviews.Author: diverjs
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old son and I spent 3 nights at Springhill Suites this August and I highly recommend this property. The front desk staff were fantastic and always ready to help. For example, we had a plumbing issue (our fault not the hotel's) and within minutes it was dealt with and resolved. While it took two calls, it was also 8am Sunday morning during the rush of check-outs, they they still were pleasant and took care of the problem. As for the location - it is a short walk to the convention center and there are countless stores and small malls and eateries within 15 minutes of the door. We never needed a car the entire time. Even on our last day when we missed the final tour bus back from Pikes Place market walk back was maybe 20 minutes (and not at all difficult). The morning breakfast was good - eggs, meat, oatmeal, fresh make-it-yourself waffles with strawberries... Even the coffee was surprisingly good at the breakfast bar (of course, it's Seattle - it better, be). Overall a great stay - for the price, too - and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: LesIllinois
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Bright and clean. Friendly staff. We booked online through Marriott. Got a fair rate in a city where good hotels are expensive. The hotel is removed from the major attractions like Pike Place and the Space Needle. They do have a shuttle. We took it several times. A few times we used a cab. Spent four days and three nights. We are very satisified with our Springhill stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheedog
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work the first 2 weeks of August. It is right by I-5, so ask for a quiet room on the opposite side unless you like highway noise. Even the "quiet side" gets highway noise but you get used to it. There is a large 24-Hour Fitness across the street which the hotel has an agreement with, which was great and convenient as well. There is also a Starbucks next to the gym. Hotel provides free breakfast (eggs, waffles, cereal, fruit, oatmeal, etc.). Rooms are clean and average - small from a suite perspective. I was able to walk from the hotel straight down Stewart Street to the Fish Market in 15 minutes (but I walk fast). There are better\cheaper hotels closer to downtown and free bus stops. If coming for vacation or for a day or 2 - you are better off using Priceline and bidding for a 5 star downtown. Hotel parking is $18 day. I didnt see the cheaper parking lot that others have indicated.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELFREAKONE
Reviews.Content: Great hotel... friendly staff... great maid service... Breakfast is included... but... DO NOT let kid's under 12 handle the waffle maker... a young girl got burnt while using it... there should be a sign saying... parental supervision required... or better yet, someone from the kitchen should do the cooking... Be aware... this hotel only has a breakfast restaurant... it is not in the safest area for a relaxed stroll... you can use the shuttle service, which did well by us... Swimming pool is very small... attracts very young rowdy kids...again, there is not much supervision... Computer room has two fast ones!

Reviews.Title: “Great place on the 4th of July”
Reviews.Author: GoWazzu
Reviews.Content: We stay in Seattle a lot and each time we have picked a different place as we never seem to find what we exactly need. Since our kids are grown up, we need a larger room with some privacy. We finally have found our place to stay in Seattle. The rooms are large with enough room and beds to make everyone happy. We walked down to the wharf to watch the fireworks which is only a 30 minute walk. We enjoyed "windo shopping" at the wharf for the $3M boats and enjoyed great chowder before the fireworks. The Springhill is a bit hard to get to off of the freeway but extremely easy to get on to the freeway. My only issue is that the beds are extremely hard. We laid down a blanket to sleep on the bed to make it a little more comfy. Very nice breakfast buffet but real difficult to find a place to sit. Get there early. The $18 parking fee is a little steep but there is a cheaper parking lot next door if you don't want the valet to handle things. The valet help is awesome as is the front desk. This will be our home in Seattle from now on. Nothing else matches up for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Springhill Suites”
Reviews.Author: DebbaJoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here June 28 for 2 nights prior to our Alaskan cruise and one night after the cruise. Room was booked by our tour company and what a pleasant surprise! The staff was great - very accommodating. Our room was a nice size with a mini kitchen. Bathroom was spotless and had a brand new shower head that was just wonderful after a long day of sightseeing. The pool was rather small and in the afternoon seemed to be rather crowded. The fitness room was small also, but all guests of the hotel were welcome to use the 24-hour fitness center just across the street - just show them your room key. Also across the street is a Starbucks, of course! The location was great for us - we don't mind walking. The hotel offers a free shuttle service to the Space Needle, but you have to make reservations for it - we didn't want to be bothered since everything was within walking distance. Pike Place Market and the waterfront were just about a 15-minute walk and a great shopping district just a 10-minute walk. In the Westlake Mall, within the shopping district, you can catch the monorail ($2 each way) to the Space Needle. There was a Whole Foods market also within walking distance that offers a great salad bar and hot food bar if you don't feel like eating out at a restaurant. You could eat in the market or take it back to the hotel. I highly recommend Springhill Suites for a pleasant stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: perryandanne
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for 2 nights June 5 and 6, 2007 before we went to Victoria. The hotel staff was great. We arrived very late around midnight. We enjoyed help with our bags especially after a long day traveling. The room was clean, large and comfortable. We didn't use it but the mini one room suite had a fridge and microwave. When I made the reservations they suggested a wonderful sedan service and for the 35.00usd price we had a sedan meet us at the airport instead of dealing with a taxi at midnight. Over all it was a great hotel and staff was just as friendly as some of the 5 star hotels I have stayed at. When we arrived in Victoria I realized we forgot my binoculers and camera in the room. I called and the hotel staff located them and mailed them back to me (I had to pay for the UPS)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: kgm0612
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from June 7th to the 10th. The hotel and our room was very clean and the staff was very personable. We enjoyed the hot breakfast each morning before heading out to see the sights. The hotel has a shuttle to the Space Needle, but not to Pike's Place, which is about a 10 minute walk. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Pat & Linda in central CA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Seattle for a wedding and stayed in the hotel for two nights. The location is convenient with easy access to freeways and local attractions; a few blocks walk to downtown. The room was spacious, clean and quiet. The provided breakfast was very good. Parking is valet only and was $18 plus tax. We enjoyed an excellent dinner at the small "Place Pigalle" restaurant which is near the end of Pike Street (look for the large brass pig and you're very close).

Reviews.Title: “Great Family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johnny_Bea
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Springhill Suites hotel in late January, 2007. I was in Seattle on business, and normally do not have my family in tow. We ended up staying only one night here (and two more at a Hilton property located elsewhere) and wish we stayed more nights at the Springhill. Overall, I can't find fault with any aspect of our stay. The best part of this hotel is the complementary shuttle service to and from major attractions. On the hour, a shuttle bus goes downtown, to the Space Needle, etc., saving us a ton of taxi ride cash. The free morning breakfast was above average, with an unexpected nice touch: small bags meant for your "to go" items (bagels, bananas, yogurt). This, along with the fridge in the room, meant lots of afternoon snacks for the kids. The pool was fine, exercise room seemed very nice (didn't use but did look in), and the staff was pleasant to deal with. Overall, a recommended Seattle hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for conference”
Reviews.Author: UofIx3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a conference in mid-January. Location had a big positive and some negatives. First, the positive--it's a great hotel if you are attending a conference that's based out of the Washington State Convention & Trade Center. It's about a ten minute walk, albeit up one steep hill. Otherwise, location is not a plus. It's right next to the freeway. My room faced the freeway and there was quite a bit of noise. I'm a heavy sleeper, so it didn't bother me, but it might others. It's also on the edge of the downtown area, so it's a bit sketchy (close to the Greyhound bus terminal for instance). On the other hand, I never waited more than a couple of minutes for a taxi and everything is so close, it would cost less than $10 to get anywhere you needed to downtown, I had a room with a king sized bed on the fifth floor. The room had been recently remodeled (or built). It was in great condition. King sized bed was very supportive, although the sheets were not the most comfortable. Room had free ethernet access to the Internet, as well as a fridge and sink. I never heard any of our neighbors. Free continental breakfast seemed pretty good; I typically grabbed a bagel and headed out the door, but there was a nice spread, including an option to make omelets. I took the taxi from the airport and a taxi/bus combo on the way back to the airport, so I cannot comment on parking or valet service. Good tip to those flying into Seattle--city bus line connects to the airport (http://transit.metrokc.gov/tops/bus/flymetro.html). I took a taxi from this hotel to the bus stop and then a bus to the airport. Taxi drive was about $5 and the fare was $1.25. Great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service, perfect for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: jwells5108
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not meant to be a four or five star property--those of you who want that should look elsewhere and expect to pay more for the level of service you expect. The staff is friendly, the lounge is nice and the happy hour is terrific, and the hotel gives you free access to an excellent gym across the street (plus the hotel has its own gym--pretty cool). This is an excellent business travel hotel--they leave you alone, breakfast is delicious and free, the soaps are high quality, and the location is central, if not just a bit out of the way from the main business area. I am a very light sleeper yet the room I had on the highway didn't bother me t all--the traffic flow is constant--no horns to bother you. The traffic sounds like a regualr window air conditioner--not a bother at all. Other people have written how then had 5 people in the room and were surprised at the lack of services--NO regualr hotel room can accomodate 5 people--these people shoul dhaave gotten two rooms, not one, so its not the hotel's fault that they were unhappy. The shuttle van is also a great value and an excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay... Nice price...”
Reviews.Author: Kyndra
Reviews.Content: Every hotel downtown was booked which turned out to be a good thing because we got to stay here! Myself and 5 others stayed in one room that had two queen beds and a pull out sofa bed. Surprisingly it wasn't as cramped as you may think! The beds were comfy, the room was somewhat spacious, the view was terrible, but the location was great. It seemed like it was going to be a long walk to the shoppping area but it wasn't bad at all, probably less then 8 blocks, it was myself and two other women at night, and we felt completely comfortable. The parking situation worked out well for us because it is valet and I'd rather just pay someone then to hassel with downtown parking. There is a Starbucks right across the street so that is also nice, the breakfast is excellent and the eating area as well. The lines are long so get down there early! The bathroom was huge. The only complaints I had about it, which one is kind of silly, is that our bathroom was handicap accesable (wheelchair), which is great except that none of us needed it, and water pretty much went everywhere becasue the shower had no enclosure just a curtain, so that wheelchairs to get in and out easily. And the second BIGGEST complaint was that the toilet would clog easily and it would not flush, so we had to go down to the lobby every time we had to use the restroom. I called the front desk, and physically went down to the front desk, but they never sent anyone to fix it. I can only hope that they fixed it after we checked out. Overall this was a very pleasant stay and I would reccomend that you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, good value, service lacking!”
Reviews.Author: prettystella
Reviews.Content: I did enjoy most of the things about my stay here! We paid $99 plus tax for a king suite which was immaculately clean (something i am very picky about) and comfortable and nicely decorated. I liked that there was a bar onsite and we could order room service. We walked around the area a little bit but mostly stayed in the hotel and enjoyed ourselves. The breakfast was nice but I could see how it could get boring after more than a few days! We didn't use the pool at all because it was always busy! I noticed they had a computer area where you can check email which I think is a great amenity! Things I didn't like: At check-in the clerk did not give us any information at all, not even to tell us where our room was or when breakfast was or anything, so I had to call down to the front desk later when I had questions. No opening windows, so no fresh air! The bartender was a complete snob and very rude to not only us but other people in the lounge. He had a major attitude problem! I didn't hear any of the traffic noises that people have complained of, but there seemed to be a fan on in one of the rooms around us all night long and that kept me awake! I also did not care for the forced $16 valet parking. I would stay here again! The price we paid was worth it for being comfortable, the luxury of room service, and breakast.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, nice all-around”
Reviews.Author: BellinghamSojourner
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this well-priced hotel ($99 a night for a king suite) for two weekend nights, and I was really impressed with the exceptionally welcoming service from the time I made my reservation through our departure. Every hotel employee we talked to seemed really friendly and eager to help with our questions. I was amazed in this day and age. The L-shaped hotel pool is tiny, but looked like fun for kids, and there is a hot-tub and exercise room as well. Breakfast was indeed abundant. We could make our own waffles, then add scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage and fruit. Also available were bagels, muffins, oatmeal, yogurt--just about everything you could have wanted. One morning there was sort of a long line, waiting to make waffles, and then waiting for scrambled eggs. But that's being picky. Our room was really nice (we asked for one away from the freeway after reading reviews here earlier) and it was still a bit noisy, but hey, it's the city. It felt like a deluxe room, considering the reasonable price, with nice bedding and even art on the walls that we really liked. We could even see the Space Needle a bit from our window. The shuttle runs hourly, so it wasn't as though we could reserve it to go to a certain place at a certain time. But it worked out well for us, and when the shuttle missed us by just a minute when we needed to return from the Space Needle, they promptly paid our cab fare without my even having asked. We will definitely go back when we have a need to stay near downtown Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “Something was not quite right”
Reviews.Author: Wyatt1970
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while I attended a conference in Seattle from November 14, 2006 to November 18, 2006. I thought I was saving my company money by staying here rather than one of the hotels closer to the Washington State Convention and Trade Center, but in the end I spent the same amount of money it would have cost me to stay in a closer hotel. The biggest problem I had with this hotel is its location. It takes about 15 minutes to walk to the Convention Center due to the construction and the traffic lights. Try doing this in the rain a few times and you’ll see how much of a problem it is. Going to the Public Market and other tourist sites will require an even further walk. Expect to be very tired at the end of the day, especially if you are traveling here from the East Coast like I was. Be careful with the valet parking. I woke up on the third day of the conference to drive my wife back to the airport. When I went to pick up my car, the valet came back and told me that my car had a flat tire. I am rather suspicious about how that could have happened. We did not run over anything during our drive from the rental car office to the hotel, and there were no apparent problems with the tires when we picked up the car. I have no way of proving if the valets caused the flat, but I am peeved that no one noticed the flat until I had to go pick up the car. Just imagine if I had discovered this on the day I was supposed to leave Seattle! As it was, I barely got any time to visit the Space Needle after waiting for roadside assistance to fix the flat. I also had to shell out an additional $30 to get my wife to the airport via taxi. The breakfasts aren’t bad when you consider that they are included in the price of your room. I would be more disappointed with them if I had to pay an additional fee for them. The potatoes were usually lukewarm and the pancakes and french toast had that institutional taste. They also pre-measure waffle batter for the make-your-own waffle bar, but many days the amount of batter they gave you was not enough to make a complete waffle. I also had an issue with the housekeeping. I returned to my room at the end of the day, only to find that the glasses in the bathroom had not been cleaned. I know this because my wife’s lipstick was still on one of the glasses! It was things like these that gave me an uneasy feeling about this hotel. All in all, I have to say that I was disappointed with this hotel. It was not a bad experience, but it wasn’t up to the high quality I have come to expect from Marriott Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “post cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: dougandshelley
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 3 night post Alaskan cruise stay in downtown Seattle. The hotel itself is located just west of I-5 but we had no issues with highway noise. While it's not the most convenient location, they do offer a free shuttle to the convention center, space needle and weslake mall. All are within the free zone for downtown busses which make getting around Seattle very easy. Unfortunately, they are not very effecient with their shuttle. It rarely left the hotel on time and, despite calling the hotel to arrange pick-up, we were forgotten twice. Once resulting in a 45 minute wait standing by the side of the road. We found it more convenient to walk the 6 blocks or so to the first bus stop in the free zone rather than ride the shuttle and walk the addtional 1 1/2 blocks to the first free zone bus stop. The rooms were very comfortable and large. The hotel advertises a restaurant but it really does not have much of one. It's more of a lounge that serves food on cocktail tables. The free breakfast was very good with more than the average selection for a hotel continental breakfast. The weight room had very little equipement but guest can use the 24 hour fitness center across the street. The hotel also has a small indoor pool and a hot tub. The indoor pool is not heated and was a little on the chilly side in my opinion. If many people want to use the pool at once, it will get very crowded very fast. While there are few restaurants close to the hotel, there are dozens within a short distance from the shuttle stops. A $4 to $6 cab ride over to Lake Union would get you to some very nice restaurants. We rented a car for only one day to drive out to Mt. Rainer. There are 3 or 4 car rental companies within a short walk from the hotel. We rented from Hertz which is in the convention center. I could have taken the free shuttle but was able to walk the distance in about 15 minute. Walking was easier and probably quicker than waiting for the hotels free shuttle. On check out I did have to remind them that we had booked the room for $129/night. They billed use $199/night. It was corrected quickly when I showed them my confirmation print out. Overall this was a very nice stay and the hotel was very affordable compared to many hotels that were only 4 or 5 blocks away. If staying in Seattle again, I would give this hotel strong consideration based on it's price and ease of getting around downtown Seattle reasonably inexpensively.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: finickyfinnigan
Reviews.Content: For the price, this was probably the best stay I've had in a Downtown Hotel in a major city. It was easy to find, and just off the freeway. This hotel was walking distance to the best part of Seattle, the shopping district and Pike Place Market. Had the Monorail been running, it also would have been easy to access the Space Needle! The room and decor was immaculate and stylish and huge. The "Continental Breakfast" was included in the price, and though we didn't partake, as we only had one night's stay and we wanted something with a little more "kitsch", I did get to see the spread, and it looked a little bit better than the average continental. We went to a show at the Paramount Theatre, and walked back to the hotel late at night without any worries, though it is in kind of a quiet business district so there aren't many people around. We're not really the kind of people to spend a lot of time in a hotel room, so if you like a spectacular view or whatever, this might not be the hotel for you, but if you want a clean, reasonably priced hotel with great friendly staff and a good location, stay here. If I ever go to Seattle again, I will definitely be back at the Springhill!

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: BenW
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel as far as the rooms and environment; that's why I did not rate it 'terrible'. See other reviews for room details, but there is a glaring, unforgiveable problem: The hotel sits right next to Interstate 5 (which, if you know Seattle is busy almost 24 hours a day) and the road noise is horrendous. I asked to be moved from my room to a quieter one and the desk agent assured me that the room was the quietest in the hotel. This is unforgiveable for modern, very nice hotel to have scrimped on noise insulation when next to a freeway. The rate here was $120, which is not bad for downtown Seattle, but I had to sleep with earplugs and noise cancelling headphones on. No lie. Find a quieter hotel people, you will be much happier.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room for family of 4, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: RicoRico
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 arrived very late on a Saturday and the staff was very helpful. The room was modern and impeccable, with a king and a sofa bed. Just what we wanted. I felt the price was reasonable for the quality of the hotel.
